attributes.action: immediately sack all those MPs who have used their MPs allowances to pay for food purchased and delivered to their home addresses, primary or second.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Margaret Beckett, on Sky News this morning (15 May 2009) categorically stated that food expenses were provided to cover meals taken in restaurants when entertaining, or being entertained, whilst on government or constituency business.  It cannot be, therefore, that food purchased from a supermarket and delivered (or taken by an MP) to his first or second home, can be for use in entertaining political or government business colleagues in  a restaurant in the area of the House of Commons.  This is fraud and MPs who have claimed reimbursement for food for other than when eating in a restaurant are fraudsters.

rejection.details: MPs' expenses are a matter for direct communication with Parliament. http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
